messages.content: What is ComfyUI-Portrait-Master?
ComfyUI-Portrait-Master is a custom node or extension for ComfyUI that allows users to generate portraits with various customization options.
What are the three separate modules in Portrait Master 3?
In Portrait Master 3, the node has been divided into three separate modules: Base Character, Skin Details, and Style & Pose.
What are some of the options available in the Base Character module of Portrait Master?
Some of the options available in the Base Character module of Portrait Master include 'ugly' and 'ordinary_face'.
What new option was added in the Style & Pose module of Portrait Master?
The new option 'female lingerie' was added to the Style & Pose module of Portrait Master, thanks to a suggestion from ataylorm on Reddit.
What new node was added to Portrait Master on 14.07.2024?
The 'Make-up' node was added to Portrait Master on 14.07.2024, along with improvements to the code and performance.
How many hairstyle options are available in Portrait Master as of 04.02.2024?
As of 04.02.2024, there are 117 hairstyle options available in Portrait Master.
What new feature allows users to control the pose and hands in a generated portrait?
The inclusion of ControlNet nodes in the workflow allows users to control the pose and hands in a generated portrait.
What is ComfyUI Portrait Master?

ComfyUI Portrait Master is a custom node in ComfyUI that allows users to generate portrait images with various customizable options such as shot type, gender, age, ethnicity, body type, pose, eye color, hair style, and more.
How can users customize the lists for some node options in ComfyUI Portrait Master?
Users can customize the lists for some node options by opening and editing the .txt files located in the 'lists' subfolder of the ComfyUI Portrait Master directory.
What is the purpose of the 'prompt_start' field in ComfyUI Portrait Master?
The 'prompt_start' field in ComfyUI Portrait Master is used to specify the type of image desired, such as 'realistic'.
How can users control the pose of characters in ComfyUI Portrait Master?
Users can control the pose of characters in ComfyUI Portrait Master by using the integrated ControlNet nodes in the workflow and setting the 'shot' parameter to null (-).
What is the recommended model for advanced photorealism when using ComfyUI Portrait Master?
The recommended model for advanced photorealism when using ComfyUI Portrait Master is FormulaXL 2.0.
Is ComfyUI Portrait Master compatible with Prompt Composer?
Yes, ComfyUI Portrait Master is compatible with Prompt Composer.
What is the purpose of the 'negative_prompt' field in ComfyUI Portrait Master?
The 'negative_prompt' field in ComfyUI Portrait Master works as usual, allowing users to declare what they don't want in the generated image.
What is the purpose of the ComfyUI Portrait Master node?
The ComfyUI Portrait Master node is designed to help AI image creators generate prompts for human portraits.
How many modules does the ComfyUI Portrait Master node have?
The ComfyUI Portrait Master node has been divided into four separate modules: Base Character, Skin Details, Style & Pose, and Make-up.
How can users install the ComfyUI Portrait Master node?

Users can install the ComfyUI Portrait Master node by opening the terminal on the ComfyUI custom_nodes folder and entering the command: git clone https://github.com/florestefano1975/comfyui-portrait-master. Then, they need to restart ComfyUI.
What is the purpose of the 'nationality_mix' option in the ComfyUI Portrait Master node?
The 'nationality_mix' option in the ComfyUI Portrait Master node controls the mix between nationality_1 and nationality_2, according to the syntax [nationality_1: nationality_2: nationality_mix].
How can users enable casual generation options in the ComfyUI Portrait Master node?
To enable casual generation options in the ComfyUI Portrait Master node, users need to connect a random seed generator to the nodes.
What is the Model Pose Library in the ComfyUI Portrait Master node?

The Model Pose Library in the ComfyUI Portrait Master node allows users to use a list of default poses. To use this feature, users need to disable ControlNet, if in use, and adjust framing with the 'shot' option.
Which model is recommended for advanced photorealism when using the ComfyUI Portrait Master node?
For advanced photorealism when using the ComfyUI Portrait Master node, the FormulaXL 2.0 model is recommended.
